description: Given a username, returns details about a user profile in a user pool. You can specify alias attributes in the Username request parameter. This operation contributes to your monthly active user (MAU) count for the purpose of billing.

parameters.name: UserPoolId
parameters.description: The ID of the user pool where you want to get information about the user.

parameters.name: Username
parameters.description: The name of the user that you want to query or modify. The value of this parameter is typically your user's username, but it can be any of their alias attributes. If username isn't an alias attribute in your user pool, this value must be the sub of a local user or the username of a user from a third-party IdP.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: The username of the user that you requested.

nested_items.name: UserAttributes
nested_items.description: An array of name-value pairs of user attributes and their values, for example "email": "testuser@example.com".

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the attribute.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the attribute.

nested_items.name: UserCreateDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the item was created. Amazon Cognito returns this timestamp in UNIX epoch time format. Your SDK might render the output in a human-readable format like ISO 8601 or a Java Date object.

nested_items.name: UserLastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the item was modified. Amazon Cognito returns this timestamp in UNIX epoch time format. Your SDK might render the output in a human-readable format like ISO 8601 or a Java Date object.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the user is activated for sign-in.

nested_items.name: UserStatus
nested_items.description: The user's status. Can be one of the following:
UNCONFIRMED - User has been created but not confirmed.
CONFIRMED - User has been confirmed.
UNKNOWN - User status isn't known.
RESET_REQUIRED - User is confirmed, but the user must request a code and reset their password before they can sign in.
FORCE_CHANGE_PASSWORD - The user is confirmed and the user can sign in using a temporary password, but on first sign-in, the user must change their password to a new value before doing anything else.
EXTERNAL_PROVIDER - The user signed in with a third-party identity provider.

nested_items.name: MFAOptions
nested_items.description: This response parameter is no longer supported. It provides information only about SMS MFA configurations. It doesn't provide information about time-based one-time password (TOTP) software token MFA configurations. To look up information about either type of MFA configuration, use UserMFASettingList instead.

nested_items.name: DeliveryMedium
nested_items.description: The delivery medium to send the MFA code. You can use this parameter to set only the SMS delivery medium value.

nested_items.name: AttributeName
nested_items.description: The attribute name of the MFA option type. The only valid value is phone_number.

nested_items.name: PreferredMfaSetting
nested_items.description: The user's preferred MFA. Users can prefer SMS message, email message, or TOTP MFA.

nested_items.name: UserMFASettingList
nested_items.description: The MFA options that are activated for the user. The possible values in this list are SMS_MFA, EMAIL_OTP, and SOFTWARE_TOKEN_MFA.
(string) ---
